pages.text:
April 2022 County of Marin EMS R 4
BRONCHOSPASM/ASTHMA/COPD
Indications
• Acute or progressive shortness of breath, chest discomfort, wheezing, cyanosis
ALS RMC
Mild to Moderate Severe
• Pt may be unable to speak full • Altered mental status
sentences • Minimal air movement
• Minimal accessory muscle use • Inability to speak
• Significant desaturation <90%
• Cyanosis
• Albuterol 5mg in 6ml NS HHN
• MR if necessary
• Atrovent 500mcg (2.5ml) HHN • Consider CPAP
• Albuterol 5mg in 6ml NS HHN
• MR if necessary
• Atrovent 500mcg (2.5ml) HHN
• If Albuterol and Atrovent not
effective:
• Epinephrine 0.3mg IM
(1mg/ml concentration)
• MR once in 5 min
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
• Do not repeat Albuterol/Atrovent if significant tachycardia or chest pain
• Epinephrine side effects may include anxiety, tremor, tachycardia, HTN and headache
• Consider use of patient actuated nebulizer with prolonged scene times and/or transport times
over 10 minutes.
• Suspected carbon monoxide in cases of exposure to fire or smoke in confined areas; pulse
oximetry in these settings is not accurate measure of respiratory status
